@Marco, Need your input here.  Can Meta propose adding an OEM method to AccountService in DMTF?  It would likely look very similar to how LogEntry OEM is enabled, with a com.facebook OEM schema added to be able to enable this mode.

The existing standard didn't account for OEM-specified parsing mechanisms.

Hi Ed, thank you for working on this on such short notice. Discussing with mikechoi@meta.com, we decided to prioritise support for UPNs in our certs so we won't need this option (our TLS certs should have new UPN by the end of the year and I plan to develop/validate support for it soon).

Until then, specific internal tooling will be developed to support vendor BMC platforms that don't have the meta certificate parsing flag (e.g. using password auth).

> Hi Ed, thank you for working on this on such short notice. Discussing with mikechoi@meta.com, we decided to prioritise support for UPNs in our certs so we won't need this option (our TLS certs should have new UPN by the end of the year and I plan to develop/validate support for it soon).


That's good information to know.  We'll still need this patch as a base, because the default is pretty unlikely to be UPN, so we'll still need to select between UPN and CommonName at runtime.

> 
> Until then, specific internal tooling will be developed to support vendor BMC platforms that don't have the meta certificate parsing flag (e.g. using password auth).

Understood.
Why do we end up needing two options to enable the single thing?

I'm assuming you mean BMCWEB_META_TLS_COMMON_NAME_PARSING and BMCWEB_MUTUAL_TLS_COMMON_NAME_PARSING_DEFAULT ?

One sets whether Meta mode is allowed at all, the other sets what the default parsing mode should be.  In your guys case, I suspect you'll want both meta mode as enabled and as the default.
But it means that systems can now enable Meta mode without necessarily needing to have it as the default, and lets us add the other Redfish-defined modes (like UPN) soon.
